Models¶

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.BodyPart(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The BodyPart model is used by the Item model. An item will have a BodyPart that it can be placed on. This model is used in the case that only one item can be equipped per body part.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedItem(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Every time a user purchases an item, a CollectedItem instance is created. The CollectedItem model is used as to create a many-to-many relationship between the Item and the User models

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedPet(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Whenever a user purchases a pet, an instance of the CollectedPet is created. It is used to provide a many-to-many link between pets and users.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.CollectedScenery(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Whenever a user purchases a scenery, an instance of the CollectedScenery model is created. This is used to create a many-to-many relationship between a user and a scenery item

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Experience(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Experience model is essentially just Fitbit steps for a day. An instance of the Experience model is created for every recorded day of Fitbit data.

It is used to calculate the total amount of steps the user has walked, while a pet has been active.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Happiness(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

An instance of the Happiness model is created for every recorded day of Fitbit data. Happiness is very similar to Experience, however a function is performed to turn it into a percentage of a number.

This number will most likely be around 7,500-10,000. The recommended minimum amount of steps a person should take in a day.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Inventory(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Inventory model is used for keeping track of all a users pets, items, etc.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Item(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Item model is created for every item in the store. The model contains information such as which pet the item can be used on, its name, and the location of the image.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Level(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each user pet has an instance of the Level model, this is to determine its current level and the amount of exerience required to progress to the next one.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallenge(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The MicroChallenge model contains information for each micro challenge in Tracktivity Pets. It contains the name of the challenge, a brief overview, the type of challenge (So far this can only be STEPS_IN_DURATION), and the duration of the challenge.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallengeGoal(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A MicroChallengeGoal contains information about what needs to be done in order to achieve a goal. It also contains how many pet pennies the user should be rewarded on completion.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallengeMedal(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The MicroChallengeMedal model is used to represent a user completing a micro challenge The current possible medals are Gold, Silver and Bronze.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.MicroChallengeState(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A MicroChallengeState is used to store the amount of steps a user has currently completed while completing a challenge and the amount of steps required to complete a challenge. These can be compared so that it can be determined if a user has completed a challenge or not.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Mood(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Pets have differing moods depending on its happiness. This model contains information such as the location for the image that reflects the pets mood.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Pet(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
Every pet in Tracktivity Pets has an instance of the Pet model.
This model contains information such as minimum level for the pet, the default name for the pet, the cost of the pet, and the amount of experience required to unlock the pet from the store.
class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.PetSwap(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A PetSwap instance is created whenever a user swaps their current pet. This is used to work out how to divide experience between a users pets.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Phrase(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A pet will have multiple phrases for each of its moods. A pet will only say a phrase if it is currently in the corresponding mood.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Profile model is used to store information about the users account. Some of this information includes the users current pet, total pet pennies, and the last time the application has synchronised with the users Fitbit.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Scenery(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Every possible scenery item available for a user to purchase will need an instance of the Scenery model. It provides information such as the experience to unlock, the location path to the image, a short description of the image, the name of the scene, and also the cost to purchase this scenery item.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.Story(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The Story model contains unlockble stories for each of the pets in Tracktivity Pets. The model also contains information such as the level to unlock the story and which pet the story is for.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.UserMicroChallenge(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The UserMicroChallenge is created whenever a user starts a MicroChallenge It contains information used to determine when a user has completed a micro challenge.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.UserMicroChallengeGoalStatus(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Used to store whether or not a micro challenge has been completed or not.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.UserMicroChallengeState(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

The UserMicroChallengeState model is created whenever a user starts a challenge. It is used to create a many-to-many relationship between the User and MicroChallengeState models.

class tracktivityPetsWebsite.models.UserNotification(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A UserNotification is used to keep track of updates, so that a user can be notified. These types of notifications can be a number of types such as: a pet levelling up, experience being gained, a micro challenge goal completed, or a story is unlocked.
